intro: Mariscus albus, commonly known as the white mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
